summary: This document is an email chain from July 28, 2019, regarding the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It details his removal from psychological observation, his complaints about medical issues (numbness in his arm and neck), poor conditions (a malfunctioning toilet and inadequate meals), and his extensive daily legal consultations. The email was sent the day before Epstein was found dead in his cell.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was taken off psychological observation on July 28, 2019, and was described as 'psychologically stable'.
Epstein complained of medical issues including numbness in his right arm, neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
Epstein reported extremely poor cell conditions, specifically a toilet that ran for 45 minutes, which he found so distressing he resorted to urinating in a cup.
Epstein complained about his schedule, stating he was in 'Attorney Conference' from 8 AM to 8 PM daily and had only received one meal (a sandwich) the previous day at 4:15 PM.
This internal email regarding Epstein's status and complaints was sent on July 28, 2019, one day before he was found dead in his cell on July 29, 2019.
